note: A disease outbreak is endemic in a country if it is consistently present in the country. "Previously reported cases" means that at least one locally transmitted case has been reported, but the whole transmission cycle has not been demonstrated in the country.
title: Visceral leishmaniasis endemicity
subtitle: [Leishmaniasis](#dod:leishmaniasis) is a disease caused by parasites, which are spread to humans by infected sandflies. The visceral form is the most severe form of the disease. It affects the liver, spleen, and bone marrow, causing symptoms such as fever, weight loss, anemia, and swelling of these organs.
